definition: to shun/to avoid (sb)/to skirt/to evade (an issue)/to step back/to withdraw/to recuse (a judge etc)
variant of 迴避|回避[hui2 bi4]
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

sentences.english: For many years, he avoided lakes "ending."
sentences.chinese: 多年来，他回避《笑傲江湖》的结局。

sentences.english: The property right need to be very clearly and blench of the pawn of bank.
sentences.chinese: 房产产权清晰，尽量回避银行抵押物业。

sentences.english: I always have the feeling that something was avoided or hidden.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得某些事情被回避或隐藏了。

sentences.english: Try your best to sidestep for sensitive issues like this.
sentences.chinese: 你应尽可能地回避像这类敏感的问题。

sentences.english: It avoids the intellectualism of christian theology .
sentences.chinese: 它回避宗教神学的唯理智论。

sentences.english: I'm serious. I avoided her question.
sentences.chinese: 我语塞，支支吾吾地回避了她的问题。

sentences.english: Choosing standard money of charge to an account is business accounting of accounting of industry of condition foreign enterprise cannot evasive problem.
sentences.chinese: 选择记账本位币是境外企业会计核算不能回避的问题。

sentences.english: Deciding on the application of challenge.
sentences.chinese: 关于申请回避的审查决定。

sentences.english: The flow-chats both muhi-solution selection and singular position avoidance are offered.
sentences.chinese: 给出了选择逆解和回避奇异位置的算法流程。

sentences.english: He ducked out the back to avoid the reporters.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速离开后面以便回避记者。

sentences.english: Van Loon did not shy away from controversial statements.
sentences.chinese: 房龙并不回避富有争议的言论。

sentences.english: More broadly, Alceste shuns all of mankind, of which he is also part.
sentences.chinese: 更广泛地说，阿尔切斯特回避全人类，他也是。

sentences.english: In the description of linacs we have swept many problems.
sentences.chinese: 在对直线加速器的描述中，我们已经回避了许多问题。

sentences.english: What am I avoiding right now?
sentences.chinese: 此刻我正回避的是什么？
颤抖的尸体回避著阳光。

sentences.english: Experience has taught us that to adopt an ostrich-like policy here is suicidal.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们对现实采取回避态度是自取灭亡。

definition: to avoid/to evade/to keep away from
to face squarely/to meet head on/to face up to
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to avert/to prevent/to avoid/to refrain from
